sentences.english: My name is Kennedy name, if not dead can still laugh rampant.
sentences.chinese: 我姓堅名強，只要沒死就還能笑的猖狂。

sentences.english: Spring winds today are blowing in wild eddies, driving dust and dead leaves away.
sentences.chinese: 今天春風猖狂地吹起旋舞，把塵土和枯葉都掃走了。

sentences.english: Is almost choked by unresisted lust.
sentences.chinese: 審慎的顧慮幾乎被猖狂的慾念窒息。

sentences.english: Cheating and grade inflation are rampant and quietly tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 作弊和分數貶值猖狂而且被默許。

sentences.english: Oh, we attended Crazy English Camp together three months ago.
sentences.chinese: 噢，三個月前，我們一起加入了猖狂英語集訓營。

sentences.english: Don't be too crazy, so crazy will come to no good end.
sentences.chinese: 不要太猖狂吧，太猖狂就沒有好下場。

sentences.english: Don't be too crazy, so crazy will come to no good end.
sentences.chinese: 不要太猖狂吧，太猖狂就沒有好下場。

sentences.english: The criminals wouldn't be so savage if they weren't protected by powerful people.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有大紅傘的庇護，這些罪犯不會如此猖狂。

sentences.english: Front of the situation is grim, furious behind enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 前方形勢嚴峻，後方敵特猖狂。

sentences.english: Yet the pirates are still hijacking ships and receiving ransoms with apparent impunity.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，加勒比海盜們仍在猖狂地綁架船隻並收受贖金。

definition: regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to speak conceited nonsense/to come out with arrogant claptrap
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
to go on the rampage/to riot/to run amuck
